thread.title: TSA agent arrested for alleged sexual abuse of 22-year-old exchange student at LaGuardia Airport, sources say - @NBCNewYork
thread.title_full: TSA agent arrested for alleged sexual abuse of 22-year-old exchange student at LaGuardia Airport, sources say - @NBCNewYork

author: Tricia McDermott
title: TSA agent arrested for alleged sexual abuse of 22-year-old exchange student at LaGuardia Airport, sources say - @NBCNewYork
text: Bloomberg via Getty Images Updated 8 minutes ago A Transportation Security Administration screener at LaGuardia Airport has been arrested for allegedly sexually abusing a 22-year-old foreign exchange student when she arrived in Queens this week, Port Authority police sources tell NBC 4 New York. The student, who is from Korea, lives in Salt Lake City but had come to New York to visit friends Tuesday. 'Documentary Now!' Episode Postponed After Shootings When she arrived at the airport, a male TSA agent approached her and asked her to follow him for "additional screening," the sources said. He said he needed to see if she had a knife or a weapon. The victim, who does not speak English well, followed him to the men's restroom. There, the screener asked the woman to lift her shirt, according to the Port Authority Police sources. Top News Photos of the Week He allegedly touched her breasts and put his hand down her shorts before letting her leave the bathroom. The woman told other TSA officers about the attack and Port Authority Police took a report, the sources told NBC 4 New York. The agent faces charges of sexual abuse, forcible touching, unlawful imprisonment and official misconduct. The TSA did not immediately respond to phone or email requests seeking comment.
